alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 6:53AM EST until January 02 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Horton, Lovejoy, Americus, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin Hwy. 16, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 12.5 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM EST Saturday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.9 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 10/13/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
